pageContext.analysis: The day the Bureau of Labor Statistics released its employment report for Trump's first full month in office, Trump retweeted Drudge Report: "GREAT AGAIN: +235,000." This was a clear flip-flop from the stance he held for many years prior to this jobs report. He repeatedly questioned the accuracy of BLS employment statistics, and called figures calculated by career economists as "phony." White House press secretary Sean Spicer was asked about this contradiction at a news briefing after the report’s release. His response: “I talked to the president prior to this and he said to quote him very clearly. They may have been phony in the past, but it’s very real now.”
